resources: "A equilibrium quantity will increase but the effect on the price is indeterminate ENDSTOPB equilibrium quantity will decrease but the effect on the price is indeterminate ENDSTOPC price will fall but the effect on the equilibrium quantity will be indeterminate ENDSTOPD price will rise but the effect on the equilibrium quantity will be indeterminate" "A shifting the demand curve to the left ENDSTOPB shifting the demand curve to the right ENDSTOPC shifting the supply curve to the right ENDSTOPD shifting the supply curve to the left" "A An input in the production process became more expensive. ENDSTOPB The price of a close substitute for the good increased. ENDSTOPC An input in the production process became more expensive and the price of a close substitute increased. ENDSTOPD An input in the production process became more expensive and the price of a close substitute decreased." "A excess supply ENDSTOPB excess demand ENDSTOPC a decrease in price and a decrease in the quantity traded ENDSTOPD an increase in price and an increase in the quantity traded" "A the demand for X and Y are both price inelastic ENDSTOPB X and Y are substitutes ENDSTOPC X and Y are complements ENDSTOPD the demand for X and Y are both price elastic" "A income increases and the Good is normal ENDSTOPB its price rises and demand is price elastic ENDSTOPC its price rises and demand is price inelastic ENDSTOPD income falls and the Good is inferior" "A The price of Good X would fall by exactly £5. ENDSTOPB The price of Good X would fall by less than £5. ENDSTOPC The price of Good X would fall by more than £5. ENDSTOPD The price of Good X would fall by exactly £10." "A rise at an increasing rate as the consumption of Good X increases ENDSTOPB rise at a decreasing rate as the consumption of Good X increases ENDSTOPC fall at an increasing rate as the consumption of Good X increases ENDSTOPD fall at a decreasing rate as the consumption of Good X increases" "A suggests people who know they are a bad risk are more inclined to take out insurance ENDSTOPB suggests people who know they are a bad risk are less inclined to take out insurance ENDSTOPC suggests a policyholder may act in a way which makes an insured event less likely to occur ENDSTOPD suggests a policyholder may act in a way which makes an insured event more likely to occur" "A total sales are maximised ENDSTOPB average total costs are minimised ENDSTOPC marginal cost equals marginal revenue ENDSTOPD average revenue is maximised" "A Country Y has an absolute advantage in the production of both goods ENDSTOPB Country Y has a comparative advantage in the production of bicycles ENDSTOPC Country X has a comparative advantage in the production of bicycles ENDSTOPD Country Y has a comparative advantage in the production of cars" "A There is freedom of entry and exit to the industry. ENDSTOPB There are many firms supplying the market. ENDSTOPC Firms can lower their prices without influencing the behaviour of other firms. ENDSTOPD Each firm faces a horizontal demand curve." "A increase output and reduce price ENDSTOPB reduce price and output ENDSTOPC increase price and output ENDSTOPD reduce output and increase price" "A the market price to increase and the quantity traded to decrease ENDSTOPB the market price to decrease and the quantity traded to decrease ENDSTOPC the market price to increase and the quantity traded to increase ENDSTOPD no change to price or the quantity traded" "A suggests that price will remain constant even with fluctuations in demand ENDSTOPB assumes that competitors will match price cuts and ignore price increases ENDSTOPC assumes that marginal revenue sometimes increases with output ENDSTOPD suggests how the current price is determined" "A Real GDP per capita falls ENDSTOPB Real GDP per capita rises ENDSTOPC Real GDP falls ENDSTOPD Real GDP rises" "A deduct transfer payments ENDSTOPB deduct any indirect taxes paid by firms ENDSTOPC add net property income from abroad ENDSTOPD deduct depreciation" "A the marginal utility of an extra pound of income decreases as more income is received ENDSTOPB the marginal utility of an extra pound of income increases as more income is received ENDSTOPC there will always be some individuals willing to take risks while others will be unwilling to take risks regardless of the pay offs ENDSTOPD investors will only take an increased risk if the marginal utility of risk over the price of risk rises" "A A fall in wages. ENDSTOPB An increase in imported commodity prices. ENDSTOPC An increase in consumer expenditure. ENDSTOPD An increase in direct taxes." "A The marginal propensity to consume. ENDSTOPB The autonomous expenditure multiplier. ENDSTOPC The vertical long run aggregate supply curve. ENDSTOPD The speculative demand for money." "A 0.4 ENDSTOPB 0.6 ENDSTOPC 0.67 ENDSTOPD 0.7" "A The demand for air travel is price inelastic. ENDSTOPB The demand for air travel is price elastic. ENDSTOPC The demand for air travel is perfectly price elastic. ENDSTOPD The demand for air travel perfectly price inelastic." "A fall as the short term interest rate rises ENDSTOPB fall as the short term interest rate falls ENDSTOPC rise as the short term interest rate rises ENDSTOPD rise as the short term interest rate falls" "A an increase in aggregate demand and a reduction in real output and unemployment ENDSTOPB an increase in aggregate demand, real output and unemployment ENDSTOPC an increase in aggregate demand and real output and a reduction in unemployment ENDSTOPD a reduction in aggregate demand and real output and an increase in unemployment" "A 4.8% ENDSTOPB 4.0% ENDSTOPC 5.0% ENDSTOPD 5.3%" "A increasing its net liabilities and increasing its net assets ENDSTOPB decreasing its net liabilities and increasing its net assets ENDSTOPC increasing its net liabilities and decreasing its net assets ENDSTOPD decreasing its net liabilities and decreasing its net assets"
